sense.name: increase by a factor
sense.examples: Any negative number is just negative one multiplied by a positive number. Take the principal balance multiplied by the monthly interest rate. manga PLUS horror MULTIPLIED BY youtube = AWESOME! Do we want France's problems, multiplied by a factor of three?

sense.name: breed, reproduce
sense.examples: For this parent stock has been recovered from remote hills of the region and multiplied in captivity. Orissa is known for crocodile breeding where the endangered species are multiplied in the sanctuary. If wolves are removed from their natural environment, then deer multiply without restriction.

sense.name: idiom--increase rapidly in an out-of-control manner
sense.examples: My weeks are never so under control and my archives have in the past multiplied like bunnies. I wish she had not used the phrase 'multiplied like rats'. Would 'multiplied like rabbits' be more p.c.? By August 2001, that lonely share of GE stock had multiplied like capitalist loaves and fishes.
